No, but Ive got money allocated towards it. Looking at the returns that you guys are delivering, its great. What is the pricing model?
Ive got a couple of businesses. So I have a junk hauling business in Las Vegas, and I also have a coaching business that Im going to be starting for sales.
And I want to start putting together videos that go into neuro linguistic programming and different techniques.
28 resorts and about ten developers here.
Its a brand new business.

Its an extremely expensive business. The big retailers like Marriott, theyre probably spending about $1,400 per tour per guest. But what theyre gaining off of that on average, Marriott, Id say theyre probably at a $3,000 volume per guest. So youre taking the actual sale and dividing it by the number of guests, and thats giving you a volume per guest. Basically, its two to three times what theyre spending in marketing.
It sounds great. Okay, so youre sending over the video as well?
Well, definitely huge social media campaigns. I mean, thats the way everybodys growing businesses today. And of course, Google.

I have a process in place. Basically right now Im going to contract with developers so companies like Marriott, Hilton, Wyndham, and provide my services. Thats where Im going to be promoting the book a lot, amazon.
Its worldwide.
So those are going to be nice potential corporate contracts. However, I want to also hit the consumer base, people that arent even in the industry.
Yes.
Yeah, it gets really hot in the summers. It gets up to 115.
Okay, perfect.

Well, actually our presentation is face to face, and we actually pioneered something here in Las Vegas that no developer has ever done since because theyre afraid of it. We actually videotaped our presentations and went through 120 point questionnaire on every single presentation on two presentations a month with agents. I mean, Im a sales manager now. Ive been a sales manager for twelve years. But it really gets into where the client was sold and the dominant buying motive and what the objectional challenges were and how they were covered using the process. So its down to a science, and once you get it, its not complex at all. And theres the element of the it factor where its something that you cant teach, its personality, its developing rapport with your guests and really getting into them emotionally.
So right now, its just basically youre qualifying where Im at and what I want to do with it. I mean, the ultimate goal, of course, is to be over a quarter of a million dollars a month in revenue.

Yes.

I actually like being the star of the show. I started self producing a reality TV show based on timeshare called Big Fish Vegas. We got a magazine cover a couple of years ago, but the pandemic kind of put a halt to that.
Yeah.

Its an intangible sale. I mean, youre selling air, basically, and its all based on emotion, and its based on Im a big fan of Tony Robbins. Ive got five certifications in Neuro Linguistic Programming, hypnotherapy, and psychotherapy. But I dont practice as a profession. I utilize it to influence the subconscious mind and get sales.

Well, yeah, I mean, you develop emotional desire and then they justify with logic. Its an industry thats riddled with a lot of challenges. Over the last 35, 40 years, the industry has gotten a pretty bad rap, and its definitely an additional challenge to the sale. However, it can be overcome. Basically. I dont just want to market to the Timeshare industry, though, because these are tools that can be used in car sales and insurance sales. Its relationship selling. Its based on emotion. And everyone buys off of emotion off of the midbrain and then justifies with the cerebral cortex. But its keeping them in that midbrain. Its keeping them in that childhood mentality where theyre sold.
Yeah.
Technically, I havent started that portion of it yet. I wrote a book that Im getting published right now.

I had kind of an interesting thing happen. Ive been in the timeshare business 19 years at the top 2% of every developer Ive ever worked for, and Ive created a lot of their structural campaigns for sales strategy and coaching. And its an industry where theres going to be some changes here pretty quickly, and I wanted to branch out and provide my services to the masses. Its nice making a six figure income, but its not enough. I want more.

Yes.

So it was a summer job that turned into a 19 year adventure, what I always say.
